CatDescriptText: Gerrie Walker, clerical worker, 1007 Warlo Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "I think that they should have the right as well as anybody else."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gerrie Walker wearing light colored coat with fur collar, holding light colored gloves and handbag, standing in front of stone block wall, window on left displaying pottery
